abstract: A gathering of American laureates for Nobel prizes spotlights the differences between two economists — and the skepticism of some scientists about economic theory.
snippet: A gathering of American laureates for Nobel prizes spotlights the differences between two economists — and the skepticism of some scientists about economic theory.
lead_paragraph: Robert Shiller and Eugene Fama, sharing a stage for the first time since it was announced last month that they would share the 2013 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science, sparred with languorous familiarity Tuesday about the efficiency of financial markets.

headline.main: Shiller vs. Fama vs. the Skeptics
